chunk: PCI DSS 4_0_1 Requirement Control 10.2.1.5 Defined Approach Requirements: Audit logs capture all changes to identification and authentication credentials including, but not limited to: Creation of new accounts. Elevation of privileges. All changes, additions, or deletions to accounts with administrative access. Customized Approach Objective: Records of all changes to identification and authentication credentials are captured. Testing Procedures: Testing Procedure 10.2.1.5: Examine audit log configurations and log data to verify that changes to identification and authentication credentials are captured in accordance with all elements specified in this requirement. Guidance: Purpose: Turning off or pausing audit logs before performing illicit activities is common practice for malicious users who want to avoid detection. initialization of audit logs could indicate that that a user disabled the log function to hide their actions.
